result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward C Wilging was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward C Wilging

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 8:39 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Edward C Wilging in court with Attorney John M. Murphy. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Wilging waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited-pleas of "Not Guilty" entered
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #3 to Possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e)

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #3 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #3 & #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses, at least 1x/mth for the 1st 6 months and then per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Austin Weyrough
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Conditions Not of Probation:
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $75 drug testing fee, joint & several with Austin Weyrough
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
To be paid today, if not paid today, will become conditions of probation

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 8:57 am
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
for continuance of the 7/10/14 Preliminary hearing
Proposed STAO for continuance of the 7/10/14 Preliminary Hearing; forwarded to the Court for review
Preliminary hearing on July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

[Clerk: MK]
Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:35am. 
Defendant Edward C Wilging in court with Attorney John M Murphy.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limits on the Felony Count #3 are waived by both parties.
A plea of "not guilty" as to Misdemeanor Count #4.

The Court requires a $1,000  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to have contact of any kind with the Co-Defendant Austin M. Weyrough
recess 9:40am. 

NEXT:   Preliminary Hearing on 7/10/14 at 8:30am.
